brief_summary.textblock:
Retrospective review will allow for an evaluation of potential patient- or procedure-related
      factors that are associated with the development of either radiologic or clinical
      adjacent-segment pathology.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Review of Anterior and Posterior Cervical, Thoracic, and Lumbar Instrumented Arthrodesis Surgeries

detailed_description.textblock:
Spinal arthrodesis can be performed through either anterior, posterior, or lateral
      approaches for a variety of traumatic, degenerative, or deformity conditions. In recent
      years, the development of more sophisticated segmental instrumentation techniques and
      hardware has allowed for incorporation of multiple spinal levels in single settings. The
      long-term consequences for spinal motion segments adjacent to such fusions remain unknown.

      The investigators propose to undertake a retrospective case study analysis evaluating both
      radiologic and clinical parameters indicative of adjacent-segment pathology in patients who
      have undergone instrumented arthrodesis procedures at Ohio State University, performed by
      either Dr.  Francis Farhadi, James B. Elder, or Gary Rea.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Must have had a Spinal arthrodesis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  NA

study_pop.textblock:
Spinal arthrodesis can be performed through either anterior, posterior, or lateral
        approaches for a variety of traumatic, degenerative, or deformity conditions.

clinical_study.official_title: Proposal for Retrospective Review of Anterior&Posterior Cervical, Thoracic, and Lumbar Instrumented Arthrodesis Surgeries Performed at OSU.

primary_outcome.description: Radiologic review will include X-Rays, CT, and MRI at pre-surgery, as well as X-rays at 6 weeks, 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 48 months post-operatively.
primary_outcome.measure: The number of patients with radiologic evidence of fusion

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: examples of clinical measurement are Pain Scores and the Visual Analog Scale
secondary_outcome.measure: The number of patient with clinical evidences of fusions
